verses.text: 亞伯蘭的妻子撒萊，沒有為他生孩子。撒萊卻有一個婢女，是埃及人，名叫夏甲。

words.definition: did not have, there was not

words.note: An old term for female servant, common in biblical texts.

verses.text: 撒萊對亞伯蘭說：「請看，耶和華使我不能生育，求你去親近我的婢女，或者我可以從她得孩子。」亞伯蘭就聽從了撒萊的話。

words.note: Transliteration of the Hebrew Tetragrammaton YHWH.

words.definition: to bear children, to give birth

words.note: An old term for female servant, common in biblical texts.

verses.text: 亞伯蘭在迦南地住滿了十年，他的妻子撒萊，把自己的婢女埃及人夏甲，給了她的丈夫亞伯蘭為妾。

words.definition: to live for a full period

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb before the verb itself.
An old term for female servant, common in biblical texts.
A secondary wife, usually of lower status.

verses.text: 亞伯蘭與夏甲親近，夏甲就懷了孕。夏甲見自己有了孕，就輕看她的主母。

words.note: Often combined with 懷 to form the verb 懷孕 (to be pregnant).
Often combined with 懷 to form the verb 懷孕 (to be pregnant).

words.definition: to despise, to look down on

words.note: Lit. 'master-mother', refers to the female head of a household or slave owner.

verses.text: 撒萊對亞伯蘭說：「我因你受屈；我把我的婢女送到你的懷中，她見自己有了孕，就輕看我。願耶和華在你我之間主持公道。」

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb before the verb itself.
An old term for female servant, common in biblical texts.
Literally 'in the bosom/chest'.
Often combined with 懷 to form the verb 懷孕 (to be pregnant).

words.definition: to despise, to look down on

words.note: Transliteration of the Hebrew Tetragrammaton YHWH.

verses.text: 亞伯蘭對撒萊說：「你的婢女在你手中，你看怎樣好，就怎樣待她吧。」於是撒萊虐待夏甲，她就從撒萊面前逃走了。

words.note: Refers to a female slave or servant in ancient times.
Figuratively means 'under one's control'.
Indicates suggestion or agreement.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 耶和華的使者在曠野的水泉旁邊，就是在到書珥路上的水旁邊，遇到了她，

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.

words.definition: on the road, on the way

words.note: Indicates completion or occurrence.

verses.text: 就問她：「撒萊的婢女夏甲啊，你從哪裡來？要到哪裡去？」夏甲回答：「我從我的主母撒萊面前逃出來。」

words.note: Indicates exclamation or a pause.
A female head of a household or employer, common in ancient contexts.
A verb with directional complement.

verses.text: 耶和華的使者對她說：「回到你主母那裡去，服在她的手下！」
耶和華的使者又對她說：「我必使你的後裔人丁興旺，多到不可勝數。」

words.note: Indicates certainty or determination.
Often used in the context of family size or population growth.
人丁興旺 (rén dīng xīng wàng) is a common idiom meaning 'the family/population prospers'.
Used to describe an extent or consequence of quantity.
An idiom meaning 'cannot be counted completely'.

verses.text: 耶和華的使者再對她說：「看哪，你已經懷了孕，你要生一個兒子；你要給他起名叫以實瑪利，因為耶和華聽見了你的苦情。

words.note: Used to draw attention, often to a divine pronouncement.

verses.text: 他將來為人，必像野驢。他的手要攻打人，人的手也要攻打他。他必住在眾兄弟的東面。」
於是，夏甲給那對她說話的耶和華，起名叫「你是看顧人的 神」，因為她說：「在這裡我不是也看見了那位看顧人的嗎？」

words.note: Here 'people' or implied 'me'.
Refers to God, often capitalized in Christian texts.

words.definition: is it not, am I not

words.note: Here 'people' or implied 'me'.

verses.text: 因此，這井名叫庇耳．拉海．萊，是在加低斯和巴列之間。

words.note: Hebrew name meaning 'Well of the Living One who sees me'.

verses.text: 夏甲給亞伯蘭生了一個兒子，亞伯蘭就給夏甲所生的兒子，起名叫以實瑪利。

words.note: Indicates the following verb phrase is a passive or result.

verses.text: 亞伯蘭八十六歲的時候，夏甲給他生了以實瑪利。

words.note: Measure word for age.
Connects an attribute (age) to a noun (time).
Here indicates the beneficiary of the action.
